TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BuiltInRole extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the type of role to check when calling the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.User.IsInRole%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration provides functionality similar to the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole> enumeration.
These roles represent the local Windows groups common to most installations of Windows.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole AccountOperator = int32(548)

Docs.summary: Account operators manage the user accounts on a computer or domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole Administrator = int32(544)

Docs.summary: Administrators have complete and unrestricted access to the computer or domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole BackupOperator = int32(551)

Docs.summary: Backup operators can override security restrictions for the sole purpose of backing up or restoring files.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole Guest = int32(546)

Docs.summary: Guests are more restricted than users.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole PowerUser = int32(547)

Docs.summary: Power users possess most administrative permissions with some restrictions. Thus, power users can run legacy applications, in addition to certified applications.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole PrintOperator = int32(550)

Docs.summary: Print operators can take control of a printer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole Replicator = int32(552)

Docs.summary: Replicators support file replication in a domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole SystemOperator = int32(549)

Docs.summary: System operators manage a particular computer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.BuiltInRole User = int32(545)

Docs.summary: Users are prevented from making accidental or intentional system-wide changes. Thus, users can run certified applications, but not most legacy applications.
